speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. A  street near the gate.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Enter SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and an AEdile

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Bid them all home; he's gone, and we'll no further.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: The nobility are vex'd, whom we see have sided

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: In his behalf.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Now we have shown our power,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Let us seem humbler after it is done

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Than when it was a-doing.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Bid them home:

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Say their great enemy is gone, and they

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Stand in their ancient strength.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Dismiss them home.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Exit AEdile

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Here comes his mother.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Let's not meet her.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Why?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: They say she's mad.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: They have ta'en note of us: keep on your way.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, and MENENIUS

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: O, ye're well met: the hoarded plague o' the gods

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Requite your love!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Peace, peace; be not so loud.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: If that I could for weeping, you should hear,--

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Nay, and you shall hear some.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: To BRUTUS

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Will you be gone?

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: [To SICINIUS]  You shall stay too: I would I had the power

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: To say so to my husband.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Are  you mankind?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Ay, fool; is that a shame? Note but this fool.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Was not a man my father? Hadst thou foxship

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: To banish him that struck more blows for Rome

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Than thou hast spoken words?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: O blessed heavens!

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: More noble blows than ever thou wise words;

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: And for Rome's good. I'll tell thee what; yet go:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Nay, but thou shalt stay too: I would my son

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Were in Arabia, and thy tribe before him,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: His good sword in his hand.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: What then?

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: What then!

speaker: VIRGILIA
text_entry: He'ld make an end of thy posterity.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Bastards and all.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Good man, the wounds that he does bear for Rome!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Come, come, peace.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: I would he had continued to his country

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: As he began, and not unknit himself

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: The noble knot he made.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I would he had.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: 'I would he had'! 'Twas you incensed the rabble:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Cats, that can judge as fitly of his worth

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: As I can of those mysteries which heaven

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Will not have earth to know.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Pray, let us go.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Now, pray, sir, get you gone:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: You have done a brave deed. Ere you go, hear this:--

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: As far as doth the Capitol exceed

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: The meanest house in Rome, so far my son--

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: This lady's husband here, this, do you see--

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Whom you have banish'd, does exceed you all.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Well, well, we'll leave you.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Why stay we to be baited

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: With one that wants her wits?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Take my prayers with you.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Exeunt Tribunes

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: I would the gods had nothing else to do

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: But to confirm my curses! Could I meet 'em

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: But once a-day, it would unclog my heart

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Of what lies heavy to't.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You have told them home;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And, by my troth, you have cause. You'll sup with me?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Anger's my meat; I sup upon myself,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: And so shall starve with feeding. Come, let's go:

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: Leave this faint puling and lament as I do,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text_entry: In anger, Juno-like. Come, come, come.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Fie, fie, fie!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
